ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Risk Status
identify the condition
Notes: Protocols 1 and 2: 1=throw condition 2= fit condition; protocol 3: 1=cylinder; 2=parallelepiped; 3=hexagonal prism; 4=triangular prism

ElementDescription: Trial number
Was the data collection invalid
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes, missing responses; 2 = Invalid respondent

ElementDescription: The time interval between the start of reaching movement and the contact with the object
The time interval between the istant in which the objects is lifted from the table and the istant in which it is released into the target
The time interval between the end of reaching phase and the beginning of the placement phase
score assigned to the reaching movement
score assigned to the placement movement
Notes: 0 = no placement; 1= no successful placement; 2= successful placement

ElementDescription: Hand used in the reaching phase
Hand used in the placement phase
Mean acceleration in the reaching phase
Mean acceleration in the reaching phase
Max acceleration in the reaching phase
Max acceleration in the reaching phase
Smootness of movement defined as mean squared jerk
Notes: Jerk is the first temporal derivative of acceleration. Lower value means higher smoothness

ElementDescription: Smootness of movement defined as mean squared jerk
Notes: Jerk is the first temporal derivative of acceleration. Lower value means higher smoothness

ElementDescription: ratio between the time to reach the maximum acceleration and the total duration of reaching phase
ratio between the time to reach the maximum acceleration and the total duration of placement phase
Identfies the motor task being completed
Orientation of shape at reach onset; applies only to PROTOCOL 3
The time interval between the first moment the object comes in contact with the top of the shape sorter and the instant it is released into the target; applies onto to PROTOCOL 3
